reflect

Class ReflectiveToStringHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.AbstractToStringHelper
      • reflect.ReflectiveToStringHelper

  • public class ReflectiveToStringHelper
extends AbstractToStringHelper
    An immutable String representation of a given object. Objects of this class wrap the data of an object specified during construction automatically using type introspection.

    As an example, consider the Person class outlined below: 

    
     class Person {

         enum Gender {
             MALE, FEMALE;
         }

         private final String name;

         private final Gender gender;

         private final int age;

         Person(String name, Gender gender, int age) {
             this.name = name;
             this.gender = gender;
             this.age = age;
         }

     }

    Now consider the following code that constructs an object of this class using a Person object as the target: 

    
     Person p = new Person("Daniel", Person.Gender.MALE, 18);
     ReflectiveToStringHelper auto = new ReflectiveToStringHelper(p);
     System.out.println(auto);
    During construction, the auto object automatically maps the identifiers of the all fields in p to their values. The above would print the following: 
    
     Person{gender = MALE, name = Daniel, age = 18}
    It is therefore possible to trivially override the toString method in the Person class as such using an ReflectiveToStringHelper: 
    
     class Person {
         ...
         ï¼ Override
         public String toString() {
             return new ReflectiveToStringHelper(this).toString();
         }
         ...
     }
    Author:
    Oliver Abdulrahim

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReflectiveToStringHelper

        public ReflectiveToStringHelper(Object target)
        Constructs a ReflectiveToStringHelper with the given object as the target.

        This constructor retrieves all fields from the given object using type introspection and automatically adds them into the structure.

        Parameters:
        target - The name for this representation.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the target object.
        Specified by:
        toString in class AbstractToStringHelper
        Returns:
        A formatted String containing all fields paired with their data of the object specified during construction.
